conclusion: To determine the maximum distance between Car A and Car B between the two instances when they are side by side, we need to analyze the velocity-time (v-t) graph provided.
Both cars start at t = 0 with zero velocity.
At t = 10 seconds, Car A reaches a constant speed of 40 m/s and maintains it until t = 30 seconds.
Car B accelerates linearly from t = 0 to t = 30 seconds, reaching a speed of 80 m/s at t = 30 seconds.
The two cars are side by side at t = 30 seconds.

premise: Car A accelerates uniformly from t = 0 to t = 10 seconds.
conclusion: Acceleration of Car A: a_A = 4 m/s^2

premise: Acceleration of Car A: a_A = 4 m/s^2
conclusion: Distance traveled during acceleration: s_A1 = 200 m

premise: Car A travels at a constant speed of 40 m/s from t = 10 to t = 30 seconds.
conclusion: Distance traveled at constant speed: s_A2 = 800 m
Total distance traveled by Car A: s_A = 1000 m

premise: Car B accelerates uniformly from t = 0 to t = 30 seconds.
conclusion: Acceleration of Car B: a_B = 8/3 m/s^2

premise: Acceleration of Car B: a_B = 8/3 m/s^2
conclusion: Distance traveled by Car B: s_B = 1200 m

premise: Distance traveled by Car A up to t_1: s_A(t_1) = 200 m + 40(t_1 - 10) m
conclusion: Distance traveled by Car B up to t_1: s_B(t_1) = (4/3) t_1^2
